intro: Petrophile merrallii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. This species is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting a variety of pollinators. Petrophile merrallii is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, arid environments.
